title: Today I purchased a brand new "gaming" laptop but it struggles to run league
body:
I've always played league at home on a desktop which I built but I'm moving to live overseas for a while so I thought I'd invest in a laptop so I can play there. I splashed out a bit and got the HP Omen which has the following stats:
Processor: Intel Core i7-6700HQ 2.6 GHz (quad)
Graphics: [NVIDIA GeForce GTX 965M] -4gb
Ram: 8gb

I thought this would be fine since it's on its way to matching my desktop stats but when i played some bots to test it out today, it was so choppy and laggy and got even more laggy during team fights, this was super noticeable as i main Riven. I changed all settings to literally lowest, no shadows, etc, etc and it got slightly better but still terrible. I made sure the video card is updated and that i was running on the dedicated graphics, not the cpu graphics.

Why would this be so laggy? The specs seem way more the the recommended requirements.

replies.body: Just in case anyone else has this problem and sees this, my "disk" on task manager was at 99% constantly hence the lag. This was due to all the 'beneficial' automatic functions associated with a new laptop such as automatic update searches and stupid background programs. I uninstalled about 10 programs and altered my startup so there was only the necessary programs running. I also found my laptop couldn't find my GPU as it was not at its most recent update. After updating my GPU and setting it to run for every program, I can play league with max fps on max settings.
Geez and I thought Dell was bad with that stuff.
